Major_Arcs.title: Setting the Stage in the Old and Modern West
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the contrasting settings of the old and modern West, establishing key characters and initial conflicts related to personal relationships and local legends.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Refusal and Ghost Town Skepticism
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene presents two initial conversations: one in a saloon where a woman playfully refuses an invitation, and another outdoors where skepticism about 'Ghost Town' is debated, setting contrasting tones and themes.

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town Flashback and Modern Airport Threat
sub_scenes.description: A flashback sequence provides a nostalgic glimpse of Ghost Town's past, immediately contrasted by the modern-day threat of an airport development, creating a central conflict between preservation and progress.

narrative_arcs.title: Modern Day Disruption: Airport Plans for Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Notions and Construction Site Encounter
sub_scenes.description: The emotional impact of the airport plan is explored through a conversation about romantic ideals versus practical realities, followed by a tense encounter with construction workers at the airport site, highlighting the clash between different worldviews.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with Construction Workers and Disdain

sub_scenes.title: Business of Cattle Transport and Father-Daughter Conflict
sub_scenes.description: The narrative shifts to the business logistics of the airport plan, specifically cattle transport, and then transitions to a personal conflict between Nan and her father regarding her duties and his expectations, revealing underlying family tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Conflicting Comforts and Decisive Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives conflicting comfort and advice from family and maid regarding Cal, leading to internal doubt and a decisive action to pursue Cal, driven by her need for clarity.

narrative_arcs.title: Horses to the Airport and the Deal

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confession and Cal's Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts Cal with an emotional confession, but his response is pragmatic and focused on duty, leading to his departure and leaving Nan in a state of reflection and unresolved emotions.

sub_scenes.title: Harsh Winter Weather and Impending Crisis
sub_scenes.description: The narrative shifts to a severe winter storm impacting the community, depicted through conversations about changed weather, snow depth, and growing concerns about livestock survival, creating a sense of impending crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Recollections of Changed Weather and Difficult Journey
Seeking Comfort and Reassurance Amidst Hardship
Recalling Past Winter's Severity and Impending Starvation
Riding Out to Face the Crisis and Uncertain Future

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Hope, and Romantic Reflection During the Storm
sub_scenes.description: Amidst the worsening snowstorm, Nan and Cal experience moments of restlessness and despair, but a sudden arrival of a plane dropping fodder brings unexpected hope and leads to romantic reflections, contrasting despair with resilience.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Restlessness and Persistent Snowfall
The Sound of Hope: Arrival of a Plane
Relief from the Sky and Reflections on Romance

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Justice and Romantic Entanglements
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to Juniper Town, introducing themes of Western justice, heroism, and romantic rivalries, centered around the character of Chane Benson and his impact on the community.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Introduction and Hero Worship
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is introduced through a public showdown, sparking reactions of fear and admiration, and leading to a discussion about hero worship and its potential dangers.

narrative_arcs.title: Advice on Decency and Confrontation with Benson

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Worries and Ominous Introduction of Mr. Benson
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses deep concerns about Jeff's behavior and seeks guidance, while Mr. Benson is introduced, initially in casual banter, but quickly shifting to an ominous tone when discussing Chane Benson, hinting at darker undercurrents.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern Over Jeff's Gun Obsession and Control
Reassurance and Premonition of Finding Jeff
Clyde's Retrospective Account of Jeff's Disappearance
Introducing Mr. Benson and Casual Banter
Mr. Benson's Ominous Tone Shift and Mention of Death

sub_scenes.title: Justification, Accusation, and Benson's Threat
sub_scenes.description: Benson defends his past actions, leading to a confrontation about an article written by Clyde, Sally's angry reaction, Clyde's justification, and finally, Chane Benson's dramatic declaration and threat, escalating the conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Justification for Writing About Benson
Sally's Distrust and Ominous Description of Benson
Benson's Threat to Clean Up Juniper Town

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Escalating Tensions
sub_scenes.description: Accusations and defenses regarding threats are followed by a flashback explaining Clyde's determination to attack Benson in his articles. Sally proposes inviting Chane Benson for dinner, leading to Jeff extending the invitation and Sally observing Chane's demeanor during the dinner, setting up a seemingly deceptive hospitality.

narrative_arcs.title: Flashback to Benson's Articles and Consequences
Considering Inviting Chane Benson for Dinner
Sally's Persuasion and Jeff's Agreement to Invite Chane
Invitation to Dinner and Observation of Chane's Demeanor
Discussion on Chane's Artistic Skills and Character

sub_scenes.title: Dinner's End and Explosive Confrontations
sub_scenes.description: The dinner conversation briefly continues, but quickly unravels into suspicion and jealousy, culminating in accusations, a non-consensual kiss by Chane, and Sally's furious denouncement of Chane to Jeff.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane's Confrontation and Accusation of Trap
Sally's Accusation and Demand for Honesty
Sally's Angry Explanation to Jeff about Chane's Actions and Intentions

sub_scenes.title: Violent Confrontation and Chase to Town
sub_scenes.description: Jeff reacts to Sally's account with upset, leading to Chane's return and a physical fight, culminating in Jeff's defeat and a desperate chase to town to save Clyde from Chane's perceived threat.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane's Angry Confrontation and Jeff's Punch
Sally's Desperate Plea and Jeff's Fall
Urgent Warning and Chase After Chane

sub_scenes.title: Town Showdown and Newspaper Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: Jeff confronts Benson in town, Chane intervenes forcefully warning Benson to leave, followed by reflections on the tense atmosphere and the dedicated work at the Clarion office to report the events, concluding the Juniper Town conflict.

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Romantic Resolution on the Ranch
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a range war conflict at Double Bar Ranch, centered around Betsy, Steve Daley, and escalating confrontations, ultimately resolving in romantic commitment amidst the ongoing ranch tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Conflict and Steve Daley's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: The scene opens with a ranch confrontation, followed by the introduction of Steve Daley as a new hire, creating initial tensions and setting the stage for ranch disputes.

narrative_arcs.title: Confirmation and Approbation of Steve Daley's Hiring

sub_scenes.title: Accommodation, Doubts, and Range War Warning
sub_scenes.description: Steve offers accommodation, while Hank expresses doubts about Steve's judgment and warns Betsy about an impending range war with 'Double K', escalating ranch tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of Accommodation and Lingering Doubts
Journey into Town and Expressed Gratitude
Hank's Orders and Material for a Dress

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Imminent Gunfight
sub_scenes.description: Betsy's trip to town for dress material leads to a confrontation with Fred Bridges outside the store, escalating from verbal threats to physical aggression and an imminent gunfight, raising the stakes of the range war.

sub_scenes.title: Decision for a Gunslinger and Romantic Confessions
sub_scenes.description: Betsy firmly decides to hire a gunslinger, justifying her decision to her father and Hank. This leads to intimate conversations with Steve, culminating in mutual confessions of love and commitment amidst the ongoing ranch conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Firm Decision to Hire a Gunslinger
Justification and Acceptance from Authority Figure
Hank's Concern and Betsy's Softened Stance
Sudden Intense Feelings and Mutual Confession

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Attack and Horse Theft
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges arrives at the ranch, sparking an aggressive confrontation with ranch hands. Simultaneously, Betsy warns Steve against violence, but the situation escalates as horses are stolen by Hank, marking a significant setback in the range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Arrival and Ranch Hands' Confrontation
Betsy's Warning and Steve's Determination Amidst Threats
Betsy's Assertion of Authority on Gun Use
Aftermath: Horse Theft and Realization of Loss

sub_scenes.title: Desperate Plea and Ride to Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Betsy pleads with Steve not to pursue violence, but he is determined to act. Betsy is left reflecting, realizing she must take action herself, leading to a ride to Devil's Pass and arrival at a scene of gunfire, setting up a rescue mission.

narrative_arcs.title: Ride to Devil's Pass and Arrival at Gunfire Scene

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Betsy arrives at Devil's Pass amidst chaos and gunfire, intervenes in a tense standoff, and is reunited with Steve. The conflict resolves in a romantic conclusion as they express relief and deepen their commitment.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Romance and Fence Line Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new ranch setting and introduces romantic conflicts and ranch disputes, centered around Carrie, Dave, Fred Gordon, and a contentious fence line, exploring themes of love, duty, and land rights.

sub_scenes.title: Personal Conflict and Ranch Concerns
sub_scenes.description: The scene opens with a personal conflict between a woman and a man on horseback, followed by ranch concerns about Curley and external threats, setting up both romantic and ranch-related tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Concerns about Curley and Outsiders

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Gunpoint Standoff
sub_scenes.description: A discussion about fence problems leads to the unexpected arrival of Fred Gordon and escalating tension over water access, culminating in Curley drawing a gun and a rancher's intervention, creating a volatile situation.

sub_scenes.title: Apologies, Guilt, and Relationship Boundaries
sub_scenes.description: A scene of apologies among riders is followed by Carrie and Dave discussing past events, Carrie's guilt, and the ambiguous boundaries of their relationship, exploring emotional complexities amidst ranch disputes.

sub_scenes.title: Defensive Explanations and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Confrontational exchanges lead to Carrie clarifying her feelings for both Dave and Fred Gordon, resulting in a truce between Dave and Fred, and ultimately a romantic resolution with Carrie accepting Fred Gordon's marriage proposal.

sub_scenes.title: Contract Concerns and Emotional Rejection
sub_scenes.description: Fred expresses concerns about the Carlton contract and Dave, leading to Carrie confronting Dave and angrily rejecting him after feeling betrayed regarding the contract, highlighting business and romantic conflicts intertwined.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Contract Negotiation and Triumphant Victory
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Fred arrive at Carlton's office, leading to a tense confrontation and Carrie asserting her business acumen. Despite emotional distress afterwards, the scene culminates in a triumphant announcement of securing the Carlton contract, resolving the business conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Assertion of Independence and Business Acumen

sub_scenes.title: Angry Declarations and Confession of Love for Fred
sub_scenes.description: Carrie expresses anger and confusion about her feelings, followed by a dismissive encounter with Dave, leading to a direct confrontation where Carrie finally confesses her enduring love for Fred Gordon, resolving her romantic conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Intuition and Long Ride Reflection

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Romantic Climax with Fred
sub_scenes.description: The scene shifts to Carrie's mother's bedside, revealing Fred's arrival to clarify misunderstandings about the beef contract, leading to Carrie realizing her foolishness, seeking Fred's comfort, and culminating in a passionate kiss and romantic resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Revelation of Fred's Arrival and Misunderstanding
Carlton's Explanation of the Beef Contract
Realization of Foolishness and Seeking Reassurance
Affectionate Embrace and Plea for Kiss

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance: Western Justice and Unconventional Love
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Dirk and Rance's storyline, exploring themes of justice, pursuit, and unconventional love in the West, culminating in a wedding and a complex resolution involving duty and personal feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Intrusion and Dirk's Injury Revelation
sub_scenes.description: The scene opens with Dirk's urgent entry into a bedroom and mistaken identity, quickly followed by the revelation of Dirk's gunshot wound and the seriousness of his situation, setting a tone of mystery and danger.

narrative_arcs.title: Revelation of Dirk's Injury and Medical Examination

sub_scenes.title: Grandfather's Concern and Ranch Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: The narrative shifts to the grandfather's worry about Dirk and his plan to investigate, leading to a confrontation at a ranch between the Marshal, the ranch owner, and Chris Ransome, creating misunderstandings and tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Confrontation and Demand for Authority

sub_scenes.title: Accusation, Defense, and Temporary Truce
sub_scenes.description: The Marshal accuses Dirk of murder, met with defense from the ranch owner and Chris. The conflict escalates with legal vs. immediate justice debates and the revelation of Dirk's injury, leading to a temporary truce for Dirk's recovery, but evolving emotions.

narrative_arcs.title: Law vs. Justice and Dirk's Injury

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession, Jealousy, and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: Chris confesses his love to the ranch owner, leading to her internal conflict as she realizes her feelings for both Chris and Rance. Rance interrupts, expressing jealousy and possessiveness, but Chris proposes an escape plan for Dirk, shifting the focus from romance to action.

narrative_arcs.title: Plea for Understanding and Escape Plan

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Pursuit, and Gunfight Climax
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris execute their escape plan, but are relentlessly pursued by the Marshal, leading to a nighttime evasion attempt and culminating in a direct confrontation and a violent gunfight.

sub_scenes.title: Moral Dilemma, Departure, and Unconventional Return
sub_scenes.description: A moral dilemma arises after the gunfight, with Dirk suggesting killing the wounded Marshal, which Chris rejects. Dirk departs for Mexico, while Chris makes a surprising decision to return to the wounded Rance, driven by love, leading to a scornful reception from Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Leaving the Wounded Marshal and Woman's Reflection
Dirk's Farewell and Escape to Mexico
Chris's Return to Rance and Woman's Thoughts
Rance's Pursuit and Dirk's Escape Confirmed

sub_scenes.title: Recovery, Forgiveness, and Wedding Climax
sub_scenes.description: Rance recovers with the woman's care, leading to forgiveness and a romantic climax as the woman confesses her love and Rance proposes marriage. The narrative culminates in their wedding, interrupted by Dirk's unexpected but benevolent return, bringing a wedding gift and resolving past conflicts.

narrative_arcs.title: Clearing Chris's Name and Woman's Forgiveness
Confession of Love and Lingering Fear
Confrontation and Clarification at the Wedding
